1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdUname.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  **		R.K. Owen, <rk@owen.sj.ca.us> or <rkowen@nersc.gov>	     **
13   |  ** 									     **
14   |  **   Description:	Provides fast aquisition of the information available**
15   |  **			via uname.  This shows a 10x improvement over having **
16   |  **			to exec the actual uname program from within a	     **
17   |  **			modulefile.					     **
18   |  ** 									     **
19   |  **   Exports:		cmdUname					     **
20   |  ** 									     **
21   |  **   Notes:								     **
22   |  ** 									     **
23   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
24   |  ****/
25   | 
26   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
27   |  ** 									     **
28   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
29   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
30   |  ** 									     ** 
31   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
32   | 
33   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdUname.c.src.html,v 1.8 2009/09/01 20:22:32 rkowen Exp $";
34   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
35   | 
36   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
37   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
38   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
39   | 
40   | #include "modules_def.h"
41   | 
42   | #ifdef HAVE_UNAME
43   | #  include <sys/utsname.h>
44   | #else
45   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
46   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
47   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
48   | typedef	struct	utsname {
49   | 	char	sysname[ NAMELEN];	/** System name			     **/
50   | 	char	nodename[ NAMELEN];	/** Node name			     **/
51   | 	char	release[ NAMELEN];	/** OS Release			     **/
52   | 	char	version[ NAMELEN];	/** OS Version			     **/
53   | 	char	machine[ NAMELEN];	/** Machine type		     **/
54   | } UTS_NAME;
55   | #endif
56   | 
57   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
58   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
59   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
60   | 
61   | /** not applicable **/
62   | 
63   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
64   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
65   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
66   | 
67   | #define	NAMELEN		(8 + 1)		/** 8 chars + 1 terminator	     **/
68   | #define	DOMAINLEN	(64 + 1)	/** 64 chars + 1 terminator	     **/
69   | 
70   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
71   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
72   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
73   | 
74   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
75   | 
76   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
77   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
78   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
79   | 
80   | /** not applicable **/
81   | 
82   | 
83   | /*++++
84   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
85   |  ** 									     **
86   |  **   Function:		cmdUname					     **
87   |  ** 									     **
88   |  **   Description:	Callback function for  the commands 'sysname',	     **
89   |  **			'nodename', 'release', 'version' and 'machine'       **
90   |  ** 									     **
91   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
92   |  ** 									     **
93   |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
94   |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
95   |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
96   |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
97   |  ** 									     **
98   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
99   |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
100  |  ** 									     **
101  |  **   Attached Globals:	flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
102  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
103  |  **					control everything		     **
104  |  ** 									     **
105  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
106  |  ++++*/
107  | 
108  | int cmdUname(
109  | 	ClientData client_data,
110  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
111  | 	int objc,
112  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
113  | ) {
114  | #ifdef PHOSTNAME
115  | #  ifndef HAVE_GETHOSTNAME
116  | 	FILE           *hname;
117  | #  endif
118  | #endif
119  | 	char            domain[DOMAINLEN],
120  | 					/** host domain			     **/
121  | 	               *arg1;		/** argument string		     **/
122  | 	int             length,		/** argument string length	     **/
123  | 	                namestruct_init = 0;
124  | 					/** namestruct init flag	     **/
125  | #ifdef HAVE_UNAME
126  | 	struct utsname  namestruct;
127  | #else
128  | 	UTS_NAME        namestruct;
129  | 	strncat(namestruct.sysname, _(em_unknown), NAMELEN);
130  | 	strncat(namestruct.nodename, _(em_unknown), NAMELEN);
131  | 	strncat(namestruct.release, _(em_unknown), NAMELEN);
132  | 	strncat(namestruct.version, _(em_unknown), NAMELEN);
133  | 	strncat(namestruct.machine, _(em_unknown), NAMELEN);
134  | #endif
135  |     /**
136  |      **  Parameter check. One parameter should be given providing a selector
137  |      **  do differ between:
138  |      **/
139  | 	if (objc != 2) {
140  | 		if (OK !=
141  | 		    ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
142  | 				"member", NULL))
143  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
144  | 	}
145  | #ifdef HAVE_UNAME
146  |     /**
147  |      **  Process the system call
148  |      **/
149  | 	if (!namestruct_init && uname(&namestruct) < 0) {
150  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_UNAME, LOC, NULL))
151  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
152  | 	}
153  | #else				/* not HAVE_UNAME */
154  |     /**
155  |      **  If we do not have the uname system call, fixed values defined 
156  |      **  at compile time will be returned. The only differenc is the
157  |      **  nodename, which may be seeked for using 'gethostname' or the
158  |      **  PHOSTNAME file.
159  |      **/
160  | #  ifdef HAVE_GETHOSTNAME
161  | 	if (-1 == gethostname(namestruct.nodename, NAMELEN))
162  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_GETHOSTNAME, LOC, NULL))
163  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
164  | 
165  | #  else				/* not HAVE_GETHOSTNAME */
166  | #    ifdef PHOSTNAME
167  | 	if (NULL == (hname = popen(PHOSTNAME, "r"))) {
168  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_POPEN, LOC, PHOSTNAME,
169  | 				      _(em_reading), NULL))
170  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
171  | 	}
172  | 
173  | 	fgets(namestruct.nodename, NAMELEN, hname);
174  | 	namestruct.nodename[strlen(namestruct.nodename) - 1] = '\0';
175  | 
176  | 	if (-1 == pclose(hname))
177  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_PCLOSE, LOC, PHOSTNAME, NULL))
178  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
179  | 
180  | #    endif			/* not PHOSTNAME */
181  | #  endif			/* not HAVE_GETHOSTNAME */
182  | #endif				/* not HAVE_UNAME */
183  |     /**
184  |      **  Set up the domain name
185  |      **/
186  | #ifdef HAVE_GETDOMAINNAME
187  | 	if (!namestruct_init)
188  | 		if (-1 == getdomainname(domain, DOMAINLEN))
189  | 			if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_GETDOMAINNAME, LOC, NULL))
190  | 				return (TCL_ERROR); /** -- EXIT (FAILURE) -> **/
191  | #else
192  | 	strncat(domain, _(em_unknown), DOMAINLEN);
193  | #endif
194  |     /**
195  |      **  Now the name structure surely IS initialized
196  |      **/
197  | 	namestruct_init = 1;
198  |     /**
199  |      **  Return the selected value
200  |      **/
201  | 
202  | 	arg1 = Tcl_GetString(objv[1]);
203  | 	length = strlen(arg1);
204  | 
205  | 	if (!strncmp(arg1, "sysname", length)) {
206  | 		Tcl_SetResult(interp, namestruct.sysname, TCL_VOLATILE);
207  | 	} else if (!strncmp(arg1, "nodename", length)) {
208  | 		Tcl_SetResult(interp, namestruct.nodename, TCL_VOLATILE);
209  | 	} else if (!strncmp(arg1, "release", length)) {
210  | 		Tcl_SetResult(interp, namestruct.release, TCL_VOLATILE);
211  | 	} else if (!strncmp(arg1, "version", length)) {
212  | 		Tcl_SetResult(interp, namestruct.version, TCL_VOLATILE);
213  | 	} else if (!strncmp(arg1, "machine", length)) {
214  | 		Tcl_SetResult(interp, namestruct.machine, TCL_VOLATILE);
215  | 	} else if (!strncmp(arg1, "domain", length)) {
216  | 		Tcl_SetResult(interp, domain, TCL_VOLATILE);
217  | 	} else {
218  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
219  | 		"{sysname|nodename|release|version|machine|domain}", NULL))
220  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
221  | 	}
222  | 
223  | 	return (TCL_OK);		/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
224  | 
225  | } /** End of 'cmdUname' **/
